name: COMPUTER GRAPHICS

values.comments:
A thorough introduction to computer graphics techniques, covering primarily 3D
modeling and image synthesis. Topics cover: geometric transformations, 3D object
models (surface and volume), visible surface algorithms, image synthesis, shading and
mapping, ray tracing, radiosity, global illumination, photon mapping, anti-aliasing and
compositing.
Students found this course “interesting” and “worthwhile.” Programming
constituted a large focus of the class. Students felt that they learned a lot and gained a
variety of skills. A lot of work is done using C++.
Many students noted a “disconnect between the lectures and assignments.” They
felt that this made the course more challenging and frustrating. Additionally, students
felt that more time should have been allotted between due dates for assignments.
The majority of students agree that this course had a “large workload,” making
the course “time-consuming.” This course was not recommended to students who do not
enjoy programming or do not have a background in computer science.
